p: Respiratory viruses not only induce a local inflammatory reaction at the level of infected epithelial cells but may also act at a distance through neuronal pathways. All parasympathetic, sympathetic, and nonadrenergic noncholinergic nervous supply of the respiratory tree may be affected by viral infections, suggesting an important neuroimmune interaction, which may contribute to the virus-mediated reactive airway disease ( Fig. 5 ).
